data.title: Ackland Art Museum
data.meta_description: The Ackland Art Museum's advisory boards support the advancement of the Museum in its local, national, and international communities.
data.text:
National Advisory Board

The Ackland’s National Advisory Board (NAB) supports the advancement of the Ackland Art Museum and its mission. NAB members work closely with the Director and staff to enhance all aspects of the Museum’s programming. Members of the NAB are appointed by the Provost, acting in consultation with the Ackland Director on an ongoing basis.

If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity to help the Museum engage with our community, please contact Mary Gard, Director of External Affairs, at mary.gard@unc.edu or 919-843-3592.

Academic Advisory Committee

The Academic Advisory Committee advises the Director on issues pertaining to the Ackland’s mission to support university teaching and research and it advocates for the Ackland within the University. The Committee addresses all issues that affect the use of the Ackland as a teaching and research resource for UNC-Chapel Hill faculty and students.

Local Advisory Board

The Ackland’s Local Advisory Board (LAB) was launched in April 2018 in order to deepen and expand the Museum’s network of advocates and supporters in Chapel Hill and the broader area, and to create a forum for interesting and vibrant discussion about the arts, the community, and the Ackland’s role in both.

Nominations to the Ackland’s LAB occur once per year. If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity to help the Museum engage with our community, please contact Andrew Parrish, Assistant Director of Development, at andrew.parrish@unc.edu or 919-962-3118.
